questions.question: Your school principal has asked you to write a report assessing the current school facilities and suggesting improvements. In your report you should: describe the current condition of the facilities, explain what problems students face, recommend specific improvements that would benefit the school community.
questions.context: You are a member of the Student Council and have been asked to prepare this report.
questions.announcement: REPORT NEEDED: Assessment of School Facilities
keyPoints: Describe the current condition of the facilities
Explain what problems students face
Recommend specific improvements

questions.question: You recently participated in a two-week student exchange programme in Spain. Your teacher has asked you to write a report about the experience. In your report you should: describe the accommodation and school activities, explain what you learned from the experience, recommend whether the school should continue the programme.
questions.context: You have just returned from the exchange programme and your teacher needs to decide about future participation.
keyPoints: Describe the accommodation and school activities
Explain what you learned from the experience
Recommend whether to continue the programme

questions.question: Your local council is considering investing in sports facilities for young people. You have been asked to write a report on the current sports centre. In your report you should: describe the existing facilities and equipment, explain what improvements are needed, recommend specific changes that would attract more young users.
questions.context: The council wants feedback from young people before making investment decisions.
keyPoints: Describe existing facilities and equipment
Explain what improvements are needed
Recommend specific changes for young users

questions.question: Your class recently went on a three-day educational trip to a historical city. Your teacher has asked you to write a report about it. In your report you should: describe the accommodation and organised activities, explain what students enjoyed most and any problems that occurred, recommend improvements for future trips.
questions.context: The school organises these trips annually and wants student feedback.
keyPoints: Describe accommodation and organised activities
Explain what students enjoyed and any problems
Recommend improvements for future trips

questions.question: Your school library is being reviewed. As a student representative, you have been asked to write a report. In your report you should: describe the current library services and opening hours, explain what students find most useful and what problems exist, recommend changes that would improve the library for all students.
questions.context: The school is considering investing in library improvements.
keyPoints: Describe current library services and opening hours
Explain what is useful and what problems exist
Recommend changes to improve the library

questions.question: You recently completed a two-week work experience placement at a local company. Your school has asked you to write a report about it. In your report you should: describe the company and the tasks you were given, explain what skills you developed during the placement, recommend whether the school should continue offering this placement to future students.
questions.context: The school uses these reports to evaluate work experience opportunities.
keyPoints: Describe the company and your tasks
Explain what skills you developed
Recommend whether to continue this placement

questions.question: The school management wants to improve the cafeteria service. As a student council member, write a report. In your report you should: describe the current food options and service, explain the main complaints from students, recommend specific improvements to menu and service.
questions.context: The school is planning to renegotiate the cafeteria contract.
keyPoints: Describe current food options and service
Explain main complaints from students
Recommend specific improvements

questions.question: Your school recently participated in an environmental awareness project. You have been asked to write a report about it. In your report you should: describe the project activities and student participation, explain what was achieved and any difficulties faced, recommend whether the school should organise similar projects in future.
questions.context: The school wants to evaluate the success of the environmental initiative.
keyPoints: Describe project activities and student participation
Explain achievements and difficulties
Recommend whether to organise similar projects

questions.question: Your local council is reviewing the youth club facilities. You have been asked to write a report. In your report you should: describe the current activities and facilities available, explain what young people like and what could be improved, recommend specific changes to attract more members.
questions.context: The council wants young people's opinions before making budget decisions.
keyPoints: Describe current activities and facilities
Explain what works well and what needs improvement
Recommend specific changes

questions.question: You recently completed an intensive summer language course. The course organizers have asked you to write a report. In your report you should: describe the teaching methods and course materials, explain what aspects were most effective and any problems you experienced, recommend improvements for future courses.
questions.context: The language school wants student feedback to improve their summer programmes.
keyPoints: Describe teaching methods and course materials
Explain what was effective and any problems
Recommend improvements

introduction.name: Introduction
introduction.purpose: State the report's purpose and briefly mention the scope
language: The purpose/aim of this report is to...

section1.name: Current Situation/Description
section1.purpose: Describe what exists now - facilities, services, or experiences

section2.name: Problems/Positives
section2.purpose: Explain issues or highlight positive aspects

conclusion.name: Recommendations/Conclusion
conclusion.purpose: Give clear recommendations based on findings
language: One key recommendation would be to...

introduction: The purpose of this report is to assess...
The aim of this report is to examine...
describing: At present, students have access to...
problems: By far the worst aspect is...
The main complaint among students is...
positives: What makes this particularly successful is...
One highlight of the programme was...
recommendations: One key recommendation would be to...
In order to improve..., I would suggest...
conclusions: In conclusion, it is clear that...

examTips: Use clear headings for each section (Introduction, Current Situation, Problems, Recommendations)
Always answer ALL the points in the question
Use formal, impersonal language (avoid 'I think' in main sections)
Base recommendations on evidence from earlier sections
